title: 2001년 United States v. Roquel Allen Carter 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Roquel Allen Carter. 판결일: 2001-01-18. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Roquel Allen CARTER, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 2001-01-18
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Clay, Hood, Moore

## 변호인

S. Delk Kennedy, Jr. (argued and briefed), Asst. U.S. Attorney, Nashville, TN, for Plaintiff-Appellee., C. Douglas Thoresen (argued and briefed), Asst. F.P. Defender, Nashville, TN, for Defendant-Appellant.

## 인용

- 236 F.3d 777

## 판결문 요약

236 F.3d 777 (6th Cir. 2001)
    United States of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Roquel Allen Carter, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 99-5430
    UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE SIXTH CIRCUIT
    Argued: August 1, 2000Decided and Filed: January 18, 2001
    
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Middle District of Tennessee at Nashville.  No. 98-00074, John T. Nixon, District Judge.
      S. Delk Kennedy, Jr., ASSISTANT UNITED STATES ATTORNEY, Nashville, Tennessee, for Appellee.
      C. Douglas Thoresen, ASSISTANT FEDERAL PUBLIC DEFENDER, Nashville, Tennessee, for Appellant.
      Before: MOORE and CLAY, Circuit Judges; HOOD, District Judge*
      OPINION
      KAREN NELSON MOORE, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      A jury found Defendant-Appellant, Roquel Allen Carter, guilty of armed bank robbery in violation of 18 U.S.C. §a2113(d). The district court denied Carter's motions for judgment of acquittal and a new trial and sentenced him to eighty-four months of imprisonment, followed by five years of supervised release.
    
    
      2
      Although Carter now appeals his conviction on four grounds, we focus primarily on his claim that the prosecution deprived him of his right to due process and a fair trial under the Fifth Amendment when the prosecutor committed prosecutorial misconduct during closing arguments by misstating material evidence and accusing defense counsel of lying. Because we believe that the prosecutor committed misconduct ...
